thread.title: On the Senate Floor, Lawmakers Agree (That the Baby’s Cute)

author: Natalie Andrews
title: On the Senate Floor, Lawmakers Agree (That the Baby’s Cute)
text:
WASHINGTON—Maile Pearl Bowlsbey, just 10 days old, made history on the Senate floor Thursday, becoming the first baby to join her parent in the chamber for a vote.
Maile’s mother, Sen. Tammy Duckworth (D., Ill.), on April 9 became the first senator to have a baby while in office. She is taking a 12-week maternity leave in Washington in order to be nearby for close votes.
Less
